title: IBM Applied DevOps Engineering Certificate
content:
Dean Didion has successfully completed the online, non-credit Professional Certificate in IBM Applied DevOps Engineering. In this Professional Certificate, learners mastered DevOps practices, Agile methodologies, and Cloud Native Technologies. The holders of this certificate completed numerous hands-on labs and projects to gain practical DevOps experience. They utilized Scrum and wrote and executed agile user stories using a Kanban board; built and deployed Python microservices using Docker containers, Kubernetes, OpenShift, and Serverless; developed and executed unit tests with test-driven development (TDD) methods; applied the process of Continuous Integration/Continuous Development (CI/CD) with GitHub Actions and Tekton; added monitoring, logging, and observability; and ensured security. The completers of the Professional Certificate are now ready to take on Software Engineering challenges using a DevOps mindset.

The online specialization named in this certificate may draw on material from courses taught on-campus, but the included courses are not equivalent to on-campus courses. Participation in this online specialization does not constitute enrollment at this university. This certificate does not confer a University grade, course credit, or degree, and it does not verify the identity of the learner.

Verify this certificate at: https://coursera.org/verify/professional-cert/YG2HCI8SQXHH

content:
Payoneer Germany GmbH

Personal Reference Letter

Munich, 25 August 2023

This is to certify that Dean Didion has been employed as a Senior Engineering Manager for the Merchant Management and Merchant Onboarding team at Payoneer for a period of two and a half years. During this tenure, Dean Didion has made significant contributions to the organization and demonstrated exemplary skills and expertise in various aspects of the role.

As the Senior Engineering Manager, Dean Didion led a team consisting of 5 Backend, 3 Frontend, 3 delivery/quality assurance engineers, and 2 designers. The team was responsible for the development and maintenance of critical portals, including the Merchant Orchestration Portal, New Checkout Portal, and Stand-alone Merchant Portal for Checkout.

Under Dean Didion's leadership, the team handled a wide range of responsibilities, encompassing design, user interface (UI), user experience (UX), and core services for the entire organization. This included the development of essential services such as authentication and authorization, onboarding APIs, and merchant configuration APIs.

As the first engineering manager hired for this role, Dean Didion played a vital role in building and shaping the team from its inception. This involved actively participating in the recruitment and onboarding process and establishing a solid infrastructure to support the team's operations, as well as making a significant contribution in onboarding other Engineering Managers as they were hired into the organization. Dean Didion's efforts were instrumental in creating a strong foundation and setting the stage for subsequent engineers to thrive.

Throughout the tenure, Dean Didion demonstrated exceptional managerial skills, effective communication, and a dedication to mentoring team members. By leveraging extensive knowledge of different Agile frameworks, Dean Didion introduced and implemented numerous processes that significantly enhanced the team's performance. These processes were so successful that they were subsequently adopted by other teams within the organization.

Furthermore, Dean Didion organized workshops at both the team and organizational levels, fostering a culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing. These initiatives played a crucial role in increasing the collective knowledge base of the team and breaking down silos between different departments.

Dean Didion's work consistently exhibited a high level of quality, earning the admiration and recognition of both peers and direct reports. Their commitment to excellence, leadership abilities, and expertise in the field of engineering management have been invaluable to the success of the organization.

Therefore, it is with great pleasure that we acknowledge Dean Didion's contributions and recommend them as an outstanding Senior Engineering Manager with a proven track record of achieving exceptional results. We extend our sincere appreciation for their dedication and significant impact during their tenure at Payoneer.

Munich, 25 August 2023

________________________________________________

Nadiia Chornokur
HR Business Partner

title: IBM AI Developer Professional Certificate
content: Dean Didion has successfully completed the online, non-credit Professional Certificate. In this Professional Certificate, learners acquired the core knowledge and practical skills to build web applications and generative AI-powered solutions. They gained a foundational understanding of the concepts related to programming and the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC). They learned about the concepts, techniques, and applications related to AI, including generative AI and prompt engineering. The certificate holder has demonstrated their ability to design and develop web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, and Flask, and build chatbots and innovative solutions using generative AI-powered models, tools, and technologies. The certificate holder is prepared for a promising career in AI development and software engineering, specializing in generative AI. The online specialization named in this certificate may draw on material from courses taught on-campus; however, the included courses are not equivalent to on-campus courses. Participation in this online specialization does not constitute enrollment at this university. This certificate does not confer a University grade, course credit or degree, and it does not verify the identity of the learner. Verify this certificate at: https://coursera.org/verify/professional-cert/FH69YBY7P8O9

title: IBM Data Science Professional Certificate
content: Dean Didion has successfully completed the online, non-credit Professional Certificate in IBM Data Science. In this Professional Certificate, learners developed and honed hands-on skills in Data Science and Machine Learning. Learners started with an orientation of Data Science and its Methodology, became familiar and used a variety of data science tools, learned Python and SQL, performed Data Visualization and Analysis, and created Machine Learning models. In the process they completed several labs and assignments on the cloud, including a Capstone Project at the end to apply and demonstrate their knowledge and skills. The online specialization named in this certificate may draw on material from courses taught on-campus, but the included courses are not equivalent to on-campus courses. Participation in this online specialization does not constitute enrollment at this university. This certificate does not confer a University grade, course credit or degree, and it does not verify the identity of the learner. Verify this certificate at: https://coursera.org/verify/professional-cert/XBUKLSUI8F82
